preflabel: Raw temperature and/or salinity instrument output
definition: Direct output parameters from TS instruments such as thermosalinograph or CTD

preflabel: Zooplankton egg hatch proportion
Plankton biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
definition: Used for plankton carbon biomass parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible

preflabel: Bacteria environmental parameters
Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column
definition: Total concentration of all dissolved inorganic nitrogen species in the water column, usually derived by summation of individual nutrient concentrations (NO3+NO2+NH4). Some workers may also include urea.

preflabel: Long-wave radiation
Acoustic noise in the water column
Raw light meter output
Secchi disk depth
definition: Measurements of optical visibility in the water column

preflabel: Sediment age
definition: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of marine sediments

preflabel: Sediment pollen content
Redox potential in sediment
Zooplankton carbon biomass per unit area of the water column
definition: Integrated zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) carbon biomass parameters

preflabel: Particulate total and organic carbon concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of total and organic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a filtration technique. This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column and is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of carbon per unit weight of SPM.  Total and organic carbon are classed together to circumvent confusion caused by total carbon data sets labelled 'POC' on the assumption that the inorganic carbon fraction is negligible

preflabel: Particulate inorganic carbon concentrations in the water column
definition: Concentrations of inorganic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a fitration technique.  This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column. Consequently, it is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of inorganic carbon per unit weight of the SPM.

preflabel: Plankton abundance per unit volume of the water column
definition: Used for plankton abundance parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible

preflabel: Primary production in the water column
definition: Parameters associated with the quantification of primary production.  This is defined as the fixation of carbon dioxide into either organic or inorganic carbon by living entities and so includes photosynthesis and calcification.

preflabel: Total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) concentration in the water column
Temperature variation in the water column
definition: Parameters expressing the variation of temperature in the water column either as a function of space or of time

preflabel: Zooplankton biovolume
Zooplankton reproduction rate parameters
definition: All parameters related to zooplankton reproduction rates
